entry.title: Lighthouse
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 102,421Chapters: 20/28Kudos: 786

Summary: Buck had lost-- he was sure of this now. His resolve only lasted a few weeks before his exterior began to crack; he was never a very good actor. He couldn’t keep up the greetings and the asking questions and the easy stroll. He let his shoulders creep up to his ears, let his foot tap incessantly. He did what his Captain told him, but stopped asking for anything more. Stopped following the conversation in the back of the engine on the way to the call; he just stared out the window, thinking about the case to come, preparing for it. When he woke every morning, there was no big recovery milestone to strive for, no big fight for the soul of his career to win. Not even the happy swell of being back on shift -- something so easy to dismiss, that had dominated so much of his life, that he had taken for granted-- that had catalyzed him each morning of his first week back.An old habit of his had returned. A bad habit.~~or: after the lawsuit, buck confronts what it was he wanted all along. he looks and looks and longs for it; the team look right through him. buck breaks-- right down the middle.

entry.title: buck and eddie go speed dating!
entry.summary:
Author: infinitelactose

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,803Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 10

Summary: Eddie gawped. “You think one of these people is the person I’m gonna spend the rest of my life with?!”“Never say never.”“I do say never. I say it frequently. I’m saying it right now.”Buck grabbed him by the shoulders and looked at him firmly. “This is just for fun, okay. It’s not life or death. And we can leave whenever you want to.”“Okay,” Eddie said, though he was sweat-drenched and still shaking a little. “Let’s do this.”*Buck and Eddie go speed dating. Eddie has a sexuality crisis. Buck has a best friend crisis.

entry.title: L is for the way you Lose Me
entry.summary:
Author: FantasyandFlowers

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,108Chapters: 8/11Kudos: 38

Summary: “Buck, have you seen Eddie?” Bobby sounds panicked.“What- no? Have you?”“No, where are you now?”“I’m at his house; it looks like someone destroyed it,” Buck’s voice falters, shaking with each word. Why is Bobby so terrified?“He’s not at home?” Bobby asks with a serious tone.“No, what’s going on?” Buck asks. Suddenly, the world is spinning; this is all wrong. Eddie should be here. Where is he?“They just found Eddie’s car abandoned on the side of the road.”“No.” Buck starts shaking his head. This can’t be happening. No. Eddie was headed home to talk to Christopher last night. He wasn’t supposed to go anywhere else.“Stay there, kid. I’m already on my way to you,” Bobby says.“Where’s Eddie?” Buck asks. He knows it’s childish, a pointless question that Bobby can’t answer.“We’ll find him,” Bobby reassures.orEddie is getting ready to move to Texas, but why can't he shake this feeling he has towards leaving Buck behind? Buck wants to tell Eddie how he feels, but he would never ask Eddie to choose between him and Christopher. But they both lose their chance to confess anything when Eddie is mysteriously kidnapped with no leads.

entry.title: In Space, No One Can Hear You Scream
entry.summary:
Author: OrYouCouldHaveMine

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,352Chapters: 10/?Kudos: 32

Summary: In 2019, Avalon Industries is sending its second ship of settlers to New Hope, a distant planet deemed habitable for human life. New Hope is humanity's chance to start again, with clean energy and a society of equality and community.Evan Buckley is twenty-six and looking for a purpose.Eddie Diaz is twenty-eight, a widower, and struggling to support his son.Both men apply to be settlers in this new world of opportunity, and are each chosen for their skills, to be emergency responders in the new world.Buck, Eddie, and Christopher each close their eyes and enter a state of suspended animation for the fifty year journey, ready to wake up to a new world, a new hope.When Buck's pod malfunctions and opens twenty-four years too early, he is faced with decisions which will determine the course of more than he could have ever planned.

entry.title: i'm still angry at my parents (for what their parents did to them)
entry.summary:
Author: allthestarsofneptune

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,567Chapters: 6/7Kudos: 470

Summary: Chris stumbles across Eddie's teenage journal, forcing him to re-evaluate everything he ever thought he knew about his parents.-or-The second Chris saw the beat-up leather journal with “Property of Eddie Diaz” emblazoned on the front in a somewhat childish version of his dad’s familiar scrawl, he knew that he should put it back beneath the loose floorboard where it had stayed hidden away for probably a decade and a half. No doubt placed there as a way of keeping it hidden from the prying hands of two nosy younger sisters and parents that Chris was increasingly learning could be unbearably overbearing.But he didn’t want to.
